name: biomni-simulate-generalized-lotka-volterra-dynamics
title: Biomni: Simulate Generalized Lotka Volterra Dynamics
description: Simulate microbial community dynamics using the generalized Lotka-Volterra model
content:
Overview

Simulates complex microbial community dynamics using the generalized Lotka-Volterra (gLV) model, a mathematical framework that captures species interactions including competition, cooperation, predation, and commensalism. This multi-species model enables prediction of community composition over time, stability analysis, and investigation of how species interactions shape ecosystem structure. Particularly valuable for understanding the emergent properties of microbial consortia.

Input Parameters

  • initial_populations (required): List of initial population densities for each species in the community
  • growth_rates (required): List of intrinsic growth rates for each species (per hour)
  • interaction_matrix (required): 2D matrix defining pairwise species interactions (positive = facilitation, negative = inhibition, zero = no interaction)
  • simulation_time (optional, default: 100): Total simulation duration in hours
  • time_step (optional, default: 0.1): Numerical integration time step in hours

Biological Use Case

Critical for microbial ecology and systems biology including:

  • Predicting outcomes of microbial community assembly and succession
  • Designing synthetic microbial consortia for biotechnology applications
  • Understanding probiotic-pathogen-commensal interactions in the gut microbiome
  • Optimizing co-culture systems for enhanced metabolite production
  • Investigating stability and resilience of environmental microbial communities
  • Analyzing competitive exclusion and coexistence mechanisms
  • Modeling phage-bacteria dynamics in ecological contexts

Output

Generates comprehensive community dynamics analysis including:

  • Time-series trajectories for all species populations
  • Community composition plots and phase diagrams
  • Stability analysis and equilibrium predictions
  • Identification of dominant species and extinction events
  • Interaction strength effects on community structure
  • Diversity metrics over time (Shannon index, evenness)
  • Detailed simulation report (lotka_volterra_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
